metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3145 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
BIND was improperly sequencing cleanup operations on upstream recursion fetch contexts, leading in some cases to a use-after-free error that can trigger an assertion failure and crash in named. Affects BIND 9.0.0 to 9.8.x, 9.9.0 to 9.9.11, 9.10.0 to 9.10.6, 9.11.0 to 9.11.2, 9.9.3-S1 to 9.9.11-S1, 9.10.5-S1 to 9.10.6-S1, 9.12.0a1 to 9.12.0rc1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3145` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
bind9-host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
bind9utils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
dnsutils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
libbind9-140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
libdns-export162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
libdns162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
libirs-export141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
libirs141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
libisc-export160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
libisc160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
libisccc-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
libisccc140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
libisccfg-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
libisccfg140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
liblwres141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
lwresd - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bind9 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.10').
